p: Considering that this PLP has more than one site to bind Ub [ 6] and a study showing that inhibition of PLP protease activity results in reduced NF-kB (but not IRF3) antagonism [ 32], it could suggest that IRF3 antagonism depends on DUB activity towards K63 linked Ub chains and NF-kB antagonism instead on DUB activity against K48 linked Ub chains [ 21, 45]; a type of linkage that in vitro seems to be preferred by this PLP [ 18]. In summary, we suggest that PLPs antagonism of the antiviral response is generalized upon the pathways, rather than focused on their single elements, and counteracts various Ub modifications.
